intro: Philodendron chirripoense, commonly known as the Chirripó philodendron, is a climbing plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica and Panama. It features large, heart-shaped leaves that are often variegated with light green and white patterns. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically followed by berries containing bright red seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments with high air moisture. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a sought-after specimen among plant enthusiasts and botanists.
